source.content: <e xmlns:my="http://my.uri/" att="att" my:att="my:att"> <f/> <my:g/> <?api a processing instruction?> <!-- a comment --> </e>
<e xmlns:my="http://my.uri/" att="att" my:att="my:att" xmlns="http://default.uri/"> <f xmlns="" xmlns:your="http://your.uri/"/> </e>
<doc> <!-- This is the 1st comment --> text-in-doc <inner> inner-text <!-- This is the 2nd comment --> <sub>subtext</sub> </inner> text-in-doc2 </doc>

test-case.name: namespace-0101
test-case.description: name attribute of xsl:attribute; undeclared namespace prefix

test-case.name: namespace-0201
test-case.description: Test namespace attribute of xsl:attribute

modified.change: The processor can invent any prefix it chooses for the namespaced attributes

test-case.name: namespace-0202
test-case.description: test namespace attribute of xsl:element

test-case.name: namespace-0301
test-case.description: Multiple attributes with same name, different namespaces.

result.assert-xml: <out xmlns:c="http://y.com" xmlns:a="http://z.com" xmlns:b="http://x.com" t1="http://z.com:t1" t2="http://z.com:t2"><foo t1="http://y.com:t1" t2="http://z.com:t2"/></out>

test-case.name: namespace-0401
test-case.description: Tests "that default namespaces do not apply directly to attributes."

test-case.name: namespace-0402
test-case.description: Test that default namespaces do not apply directly to attributes.

test-case.name: namespace-0501
test-case.description: Test of namespace stuff

test-case.name: namespace-0601
test-case.description: Test copying of namespace nodes REF: XSLT 1.0 Errata

test-case.name: namespace-0602
test-case.description: Test copying of namespace nodes REF: XSLT 1.0 Errata

test-case.name: namespace-0603
test-case.description: Test copying of namespace nodes REF: XSLT 1.0 Errata

test-case.name: namespace-0701
test-case.description: test union operation applied to namespace nodes

test-case.name: namespace-0802
test-case.description: Test use of namespace="" in xsl:element and xsl:attribute The spec says the element or attribute should go in the null namespace (Bug Saxon 6.2/005)

result.assert-xml: <doc xmlns:p="http://dummy/"><p:part1><e/><e/><e a="1"/><e a="2"/></p:part1 ><part2><e/><e/><e a="3"/><e a="4"/></part2 ><part3 xmlns="http://something/"><e xmlns=""/><e xmlns=""/><e a="5"/><e a="6"/></part3></doc>

test-case.name: namespace-0901
test-case.description: Test namespace nodes. Note, this test is now superseded by nspc12-17 which break it up into parts, for ease of analysing the results

test-case.name: namespace-0902
test-case.description: Test generate-id() on namespace nodes. modified 2002-08-08 to give reproducable results. The test now simply checks that all the namespace nodes have distinct id values modified 2002-08-08 to give even more reproducable results. Output is now well-formed, and sorted.

result.assert-xml: <out><namespace name="" value="http://chap-default.uri/" count="1" /><namespace name="" value="http://default.uri/" count="1" /><namespace name="xml" value="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace" count="1" /><namespace name="xml" value="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace" count="1" /><namespace name="xml" value="http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace" count="1" /><namespace name="z" value="http://new-z.uri/" count="1" /><namespace name="z" value="http://new-z.uri/" count="1" /><namespace name="z" value="http://z.uri/" count="1"/></out>

test-case.name: namespace-0903
test-case.description: Test copying of namespace nodes

test-case.name: namespace-0904
test-case.description: Test copying of namespace nodes

test-case.name: namespace-0905
test-case.description: Test copying of namespace nodes

test-case.name: namespace-0906
test-case.description: Test copying of namespace nodes from a literal result element

test-case.name: namespace-0907
test-case.description: List all the namespace nodes for an element

test-case.name: namespace-0908
test-case.description: List all the namespace nodes for an element

test-case.name: namespace-0909
test-case.description: List the id's of the namespace nodes for an element modified 2002-08-08 to give reproducable results. The test now outputs the id modulo the document id

test-case.name: namespace-0910
test-case.description: Check the parentage of the namespace nodes for an element

test-case.name: namespace-0911
test-case.description: Check that exclude-result-prefixes applies to URIs, not to prefixes

test-case.name: namespace-1101
test-case.description: TEST xsl:namespace (XSLT 2.0)

test-case.name: namespace-1102
test-case.description: attribute must have prefix submitted by Eric Bratton, shows bug in Saxon 6.5

test-case.name: namespace-1103
test-case.description: check that the namespace::xml node is accessible

test-case.name: namespace-1104
test-case.description: TEST xsl:namespace declaring the default namespace (XSLT 2.0)

test-case.name: namespace-1501
test-case.description: Wildcard node-tests on namespaced attributes

test-case.name: namespace-1502
test-case.description: Wildcard node-tests on namespaced attributes

test-case.name: namespace-1601
test-case.description: test use of prefix:* pattern with strip-space

test-case.name: namespace-1602
test-case.description: test use of *:suffix pattern with strip-space

test-case.name: namespace-1701
test-case.description: test that the default namespace is not applied to names in XPath expressions or to variable names

test-case.name: namespace-1801
test-case.description: This shows a bug in Saxon 6.5: duplicate entries in namespace axis when the source document explicitly declares the "xml" namespace (but note, some XML parsers don't allow the XML namespace to be declared anyway)

test-case.name: namespace-1901
test-case.description: Test that a no-namespace element copied into a document having a default namespace acquires an xmlns="" undeclaration. Saxon bug 3889.

test-case.name: namespace-2001
test-case.description: TEST copied namespace clashing with namespace of parent element Results require manual inspection because a system-generated prefix is used.

test-case.name: namespace-2101
test-case.description: test use of xsl:attribute with a namespace prefix not known until run-time

test-case.name: namespace-2201
test-case.description: test use of xsl:element with a namespace prefix not known until run-time

test-case.name: namespace-2301
test-case.description: TEST node-name() function (returning a QName)

test-case.name: namespace-2302
test-case.description: TEST node-name() function (returning a QName)

test-case.name: namespace-2401
test-case.description: TEST in-scope-prefixes() function

test-case.name: namespace-2402
test-case.description: TEST namespace-uri-for-prefix() function

test-case.name: namespace-2501
test-case.description: Testing "An element from the XSLT namespace may have any attribute not from the XSLT namespace, provided that the expanded name of the attribute has a non-null namespace URI."

test-case.name: namespace-2502
test-case.description: test exclude-result-prefixes="#all" should copy c.uri only

test-case.name: namespace-2503
test-case.description: test exclusion of a namespace that is actually required for one of the attributes of the literal result element. In Saxon 7.6.5, this causes the exclude-result-prefixes request to be ignored, so the output contains declarations of both xmlns:a="a.uri" and xmlns:a2="a.uri". In 7.7, this is changed so that the unwanted declaration for xmlns:a2 is now excluded should copy c.uri only

test-case.name: namespace-2601
test-case.description: test effect of attempting to exclude a system namespace (xsi) that's needed

test-case.name: namespace-2603
test-case.description: test inherit-namespaces="no" on xsl:element

test-case.name: namespace-2604
test-case.description: test inherit-namespaces="no" on xsl:element

test-case.name: namespace-2605
test-case.description: test inherit-namespaces="no" on xsl:element

test-case.name: namespace-2606
test-case.description: test inherit-namespaces="no" on xsl:element

test-case.name: namespace-2607
test-case.description: test inherit-namespaces="no" on literal result elements

test-case.name: namespace-2608
test-case.description: test inherit-namespaces="no" serialized as XML 1.0

test-case.name: namespace-2609
test-case.description: test inherit-namespaces="no" on literal result elements

result.assert-xml: <n:a xmlns="http://d/" xmlns:n="http://n/"><n:b xmlns:n="http://n2/" xmlns=""/><n:c xmlns:n="http://n3/" xmlns=""/></n:a>

test-case.name: namespace-2610
test-case.description: test inherit-namespaces="no" on xsl:copy

result.assert-xml: <n:a xmlns="http://d/" xmlns:n="http://n/"><n:b xmlns:n="http://n2/" xmlns=""/><c xmlns="http://n3/" xmlns:n=""/></n:a>

test-case.name: namespace-2612
test-case.description: test namespace-uri-from-QName with a null namespace URI

test-case.name: namespace-2614
test-case.description: Modified example taken from the example "Conflicting Namespace Prefixes" in section 11.7 of the spec exclude-result-prefixes added. This should not generate an error (namespace fixup should invent a prefix)

test-case.name: namespace-2615
test-case.description: Modified example taken from the example "Conflicting Namespace Prefixes" in section 11.7 of the spec This should not generate an error. The prefix "p" is not available for use by namespace fixup, so the element must be allocated a different prefix

test-case.name: namespace-2616
test-case.description: Test case for spec bug 5857 - namespace undeclaration on an LRE is not copied through to the output, because of the rules for namespace inheritance

test-case.name: namespace-2617
test-case.description: Two namespaces with same prefix: non-recoverable error XTDE0430

test-case.name: namespace-2618
test-case.description: Incorrect example taken from the example "Conflicting Namespace Prefixes" in section 11.7 of the spec This should generate an error (two conflicting namespace nodes). Corrected versions in nspc70 and nspc71

test-case.name: namespace-2619
test-case.description: test that result of local-name-from-QName is an NCName

test-case.name: namespace-2621
test-case.description: Erratum E6: Error when xmlns prefix or corresponding URI is misused

test-case.name: namespace-2622
test-case.description: Erratum E6: Error when xmlns prefix or corresponding URI is misused

test-case.name: namespace-2623
test-case.description: Erratum E6: Error when xmlns prefix or corresponding URI is misused NOTE: the error XTDE0865 is not mentioned in the erratum, only XTDE0835 (for xsl:element) was updated However, see discussion in Bug 24113, it can be assumed that the XMLNS namespace must be considered forbidden for the xsl:attribute/@namespace (and by extension, the xsl:namespace instruction) as well.

modified.change: Bug 24113, XTDE0865 instead of XTDE0835 - invalid namespace in xsl:attribute

test-case.name: namespace-2624
test-case.description: Erratum E6: Error when xmlns prefix or corresponding URI is misused

test-case.name: namespace-2625
test-case.description: test inherit-namespaces="false" on xsl:copy

result.assert-xml: <n:a xmlns="http://d/" xmlns:n="http://n/"><n:b xmlns:n="http://n2/" xmlns=""/><c xmlns="http://n3/" xmlns:n=""/></n:a>

test-case.name: namespace-2626
test-case.description: test inherit-namespaces=" 0" on xsl:copy

result.assert-xml: <n:a xmlns="http://d/" xmlns:n="http://n/"><n:b xmlns:n="http://n2/" xmlns=""/><c xmlns="http://n3/" xmlns:n=""/></n:a>

test-case.name: namespace-2627
test-case.description: test inherit-namespaces="FALSE" on xsl:copy (not allowed)

test-case.name: namespace-2628
test-case.description: test inherit-namespaces="yes" on literal result elements

test-case.name: namespace-2629
test-case.description: test inherit-namespaces="true" on literal result elements

test-case.name: namespace-2630
test-case.description: test inherit-namespaces="1" on literal result elements

test-case.name: namespace-2631
test-case.description: test inherit-namespaces="false" on literal result elements

test-case.name: namespace-2632
test-case.description: test inherit-namespaces="0" on literal result elements

test-case.name: namespace-2633
test-case.description: test inherit-namespaces=" " (not allowed) on literal result elements

test-case.name: namespace-2701
test-case.description: Identity template (using an unusual namespace prefix)

test-case.name: namespace-3001
test-case.description: Test case for spec bug 5857 - namespace undeclaration on a copied element is not copied through to the output, because of the rules for namespace inheritance

test-case.name: namespace-3002
test-case.description: Test case for spec bug 5857 - namespace undeclaration on a copied element is not copied through to the output, because of the rules for namespace inheritance

test-case.name: namespace-3003
test-case.description: Test case for spec bug 5857 - namespace undeclaration on a copied element is not copied through to the output, because of the rules for namespace inheritance

test-case.name: namespace-3004
test-case.description: Test case for spec bug 5857 - namespace undeclaration on a copied element is not copied through to the output, because of the rules for namespace inheritance

test-case.name: namespace-3005
test-case.description: Test case for spec erratum FO.E42 - comparing namespace nodes with deep-equal()

test-case.name: namespace-3101
test-case.description: Discretionary: name="element-name-not-QName" choice="pass-through" Test for resetting of a prefixed namespace by a LRE. Should see one warning about namespace "none" unresolvable. Recovery: put yyy directly inside higher element (out).

test-case.name: namespace-3102
test-case.description: Test to make sure xsl:attribute isn't added to the containing element when an xsl:element is ignored. Should see a warning that xyz:foo was not created. The <yyy/> element is placed directly within out, but the attribute isn't.

test-case.name: namespace-3103
test-case.description: Discretionary: name="element-name-not-QName" choice="pass-through" Test for non-empty illegal element name. Should see a warning about illegal element name. Recovery: put yyy directly in out.

test-case.name: namespace-3104
test-case.description: Test to make sure xsl:attribute isn't added to the containing element when an xsl:element is ignored. Should see a warning that xyz:foo was not created. The <yyy/> element is placed directly within out, but the attribute isn't.

test-case.name: namespace-3105
test-case.description: Test for resetting of a prefixed namespace by a LRE; stylesheet default NS set. Should see one warning about namespace "none" unresolvable. Recovery: put yyy directly inside higher element (out). MHK: changed to make it a dynamic error

test-case.name: namespace-3106
test-case.description: Put an unprefixed xmlns declaration in xsl:element where requested name has prefix. Should see one warning about namespace "abc" unresolvable. Recovery: put yyy directly inside higher element (out).

test-case.name: namespace-3107
test-case.description: Have a non-empty but unprefixed xmlns declaration while specifying prefixed name. Should see one warning about namespace "wxyz" unresolvable. Recovery: put yyy directly inside higher element (out).

test-case.name: namespace-3108
test-case.description: Use prefixed xmlns declaration, namespace attrib to same URI, different prefix on name. NOTE: Processor developers could legitimately disagree about where the "p2" name has to be in scope on the result. It must be in effect for yyy, but could be for foo as well. The spec doesn't address this point.

test-case.name: namespace-3109
test-case.description: Set default namespace, then reset via xmlns declaration in xsl:element.

test-case.name: namespace-3110
test-case.description: Set default namespace, then set differently in xsl:element.

test-case.name: namespace-3111
test-case.description: Specify an empty namespace; stylesheet default NS set, and reset in xsl:element.

test-case.name: namespace-3112
test-case.description: Specify an empty namespace; default NS set at two levels.

test-case.name: namespace-3113
test-case.description: Set and reset default namespace, no prefixes involved.

test-case.name: namespace-3114
test-case.description: Set default namespace at two levels, no prefixes involved.

test-case.name: namespace-3115
test-case.description: Set a prefixed name to an NS not among those in scope; prefix was in use.

test-case.name: namespace-3116
test-case.description: Reset prefix from innermost URI to outer (default) one.

test-case.name: namespace-3117
test-case.description: Request prefix that is already mapped to requested NS, default set globally.

test-case.name: namespace-3118
test-case.description: Set a prefixed name to same NS as outer default, prefix is new.

test-case.name: namespace-3119
test-case.description: Set a prefixed name to same NS as other prefix already had, prefix is new.

test-case.name: namespace-3120
test-case.description: Test for resetting of an unspecified default namespace by copy-of. create an RTF with no namespace nodes

test-case.name: namespace-3121
test-case.description: Test for resetting of the unspecified default namespace by a contained xsl:element.

test-case.name: namespace-3122
test-case.description: Test for resetting of a specified default namespace.

test-case.name: namespace-3123
test-case.description: Test for resetting of a specified default namespace by a LRE.

test-case.name: namespace-3124
test-case.description: Test for resetting of a prefixed namespace by a LRE.

test-case.name: namespace-3125
test-case.description: Test for specification of an empty namespace.

test-case.name: namespace-3126
test-case.description: Test for resetting of an unspecified default namespace by a LRE.

test-case.name: namespace-3127
test-case.description: Prefixed xmlns declaration and same-prefixed name; namespace matches default set locally. NOTE: Processor developers could legitimately disagree about where the default name has to be reset in the result. It must be in effect for yyy, but could be for foo as well. The spec doesn't address this point. On the other hand, p2 must be set to "barz.com" for the yyy element.

test-case.name: namespace-3128
test-case.description: Test for namespace attribute not (previously) tied to prefix.

test-case.name: namespace-3129
test-case.description: Test what happens when namespace attrib is a known URI, but no prefixes involved.

test-case.name: namespace-3130
test-case.description: Section: 7.1.2 Creating Elements Test for namespace attribute matching stylesheet default.

test-case.name: namespace-3131
test-case.description: Test for namespace attribute with new URI and prefix requested.

test-case.name: namespace-3132
test-case.description: Test for specification of an empty namespace; stylesheet default NS set.

test-case.name: namespace-3133
test-case.description: Two xmlns declarations with namespace attrib (matches default) in xsl:element. NOTE: Processor developers could legitimately disagree about where the "p2" name has to be in scope on the result. It must be in effect for yyy, but could be for foo as well. The spec doesn't address this point. MHK: I disagree with the above. I don't see how one could justify outputting the barz.com namespace on the foo element. But that's what Xalan appears to do...

test-case.name: namespace-3134
test-case.description: Reset default locally, but namespace attribute matches stylesheet default. NOTE: Processor developers could legitimately disagree about where the default name has to be set the 2nd time in the result. It must be correct for yyy, but could be reset for foo as well. The spec doesn't address this point.

test-case.name: namespace-3135
test-case.description: Test for prefixed name when prefixed NS is in scope; no namespace attrib.

test-case.name: namespace-3136
test-case.description: Test resetting prefix and URI to what they were anyway.

test-case.name: namespace-3137
test-case.description: Test resetting of a prefix to same URI as known prefix.

test-case.name: namespace-3138
test-case.description: Test for prefixed name when prefixed NS is in scope; also set default for stylesheet.

test-case.name: namespace-3139
test-case.description: Set default namespace in outer, then specify namespace for inner; add prefixed decl. NOTE: Processor developers could legitimately disagree about where the "p2" name has to be in scope on the result, if anywhere. Since there are no LREs inside foo, there is no requirement to pick up and emit the p2 declaration. The spec doesn't address this point.

test-case.name: namespace-3140
test-case.description: Use prefixed xmlns declaration with prefixed name; default was set.

test-case.name: namespace-3141
test-case.description: Baseline case of an xmlns declaration in xsl:element.

test-case.name: namespace-3142
test-case.description: Put both an unprefixed xmlns declaration and namespace attrib in xsl:element.

test-case.name: namespace-3143
test-case.description: Put both an unprefixed xmlns declaration and namespace attrib in; name has prefix.

test-case.name: namespace-3144
test-case.description: Baseline case of a non-empty but unprefixed xmlns declaration in xsl:element.

test-case.name: namespace-3145
test-case.description: Mix a non-empty xmlns declaration and namespace attrib (to same) in xsl:element.

test-case.name: namespace-3146
test-case.description: Mix a non-empty xmlns declaration and namespace attrib (different URI) in xsl:element.

test-case.name: namespace-3147
test-case.description: Prefixed xmlns declaration and same-prefixed name; no namespace attrib; default set. NOTE: Processor developers could legitimately disagree about where the default name has to be reset in the result. It must be in effect for yyy, but could be for foo as well. The spec doesn't address this point.

test-case.name: namespace-3148
test-case.description: Mix xmlns declaration and namespace attrib (to same) in xsl:element; name has prefix. NOTE: Processor developers could legitimately disagree about where the default name has to be set in the result. It must be in effect for yyy, but could be for foo as well. The spec doesn't address this point.

test-case.name: namespace-3149
test-case.description: Set xmlns declaration and namespace attrib to different URIs; name has prefix. NOTE: Processor developers could legitimately disagree about where the default name has to be set in the result. It must be in effect for yyy, but could be for foo as well. The spec doesn't address this point.

test-case.name: namespace-3150
test-case.description: Use prefixed name; requested NS matches default rather than what's declared for that prefix.

test-case.name: namespace-3151
test-case.description: Use prefixed name; requested NS matches default; another decl present. NOTE: Processor developers could legitimately disagree about where the "p2" name has to be in scope on the result. It must be in effect for yyy, but could be for foo as well. The spec doesn't address this point.

test-case.name: namespace-3152
test-case.description: Test crossing prefix set locally with namespace from outer level (where it has other prefix).

test-case.name: namespace-3153
test-case.description: Mix xmlns declaration and namespace attrib (to same) in xsl:element; name has prefix. NOTE: Processor developers could legitimately disagree about where the default name has to be set the 2nd time in the result. It must be correct for yyy, but could be reset for foo as well. The spec doesn't address this point.

test-case.name: namespace-3154
test-case.description: Test that exclude-result-prefixes should NOT affect xsl:element (when prefix needed)

test-case.name: namespace-3155
test-case.description: Test crossing prefix set at outer level with URI also attached to different prefix in local decl. NOTE: Processor developers could legitimately disagree about where the "p2" name has to be in scope on the result. It must be in effect for yyy, but could be for foo as well. The spec doesn't address this point. (Also, p1 must be reset for yyy.)

test-case.name: namespace-3156
test-case.description: Baseline case of prefixed xmlns declaration in xsl:element. NOTE: Processor developers could legitimately disagree about where the "p2" name has to be in scope on the result. It must be in effect for yyy, but could be for foo as well. The spec doesn't address this point.

test-case.name: namespace-3157
test-case.description: Use prefixed xmlns declaration with null namespace attrib. NOTE: Processor developers could legitimately disagree about where the "p2" name has to be in scope on the result. It must be in effect for yyy, but could be for foo as well. The spec doesn't address this point.

test-case.name: namespace-3158
test-case.description: Use prefixed xmlns declaration with non-null namespace attrib, different URIs. NOTE: Processor developers could legitimately disagree about where the "p2" name has to be in scope on the result. It must be in effect for yyy, but could be for foo as well. The spec doesn't address this point.

test-case.name: namespace-3159
test-case.description: Use prefixed xmlns declaration with non-null namespace attrib, same URI. NOTE: Processor developers could legitimately disagree about where the "p2" name has to be in scope on the result. It must be in effect for yyy, but could be for foo as well. The spec doesn't address this point.

test-case.name: namespace-3160
test-case.description: Prefixed xmlns declaration and same-prefixed name; no namespace attrib.

test-case.name: namespace-3161
test-case.description: Issue prefixed name in current default namespace, rather than the one assigned to tha prefix at outer level NOTE: Processor developers could legitimately disagree about where the default name has to be set in the result. It must be in effect for yyy, but could be for foo as well. The spec doesn't address this point.

test-case.name: namespace-3162
test-case.description: Test for prefixed name when prefixed NS is in scope; also set default locally. NOTE: Processor developers could legitimately disagree about where the default name has to be set in the result. It must be in effect for yyy, but could be for foo as well. The spec doesn't address this point.

test-case.name: namespace-3163
test-case.description: Use prefixed xmlns declaration with non-null namespace attrib, same URI and prefix.

test-case.name: namespace-3164
test-case.description: Use prefixed xmlns declaration, namespace attrib sets different URI of that prefix.

test-case.name: namespace-3201
test-case.description: Test for error recovery when assigned name ends with : (has null local-part) MHK: changed to make it a dynamic error

test-case.name: namespace-3202
test-case.description: Test for invalid namespace URI; spec says "not syntactically legal URI" is NOT error. Results require manual inspection because XML containing invalid namespace URI cannot be canonicalized.

test-case.name: namespace-3203
test-case.description: Test recovery when assigned name begins with : (has null namespace) MHK: changed to a run-time test MHK: error is now non-recoverable (April 2005)

test-case.name: namespace-3301
test-case.description: Apply namespaces to attributes This 3rd case is a base line and should not have associated namespace

test-case.name: namespace-3302
test-case.description: Basic test of applying namespaces to elements.

test-case.name: namespace-3303
test-case.description: Try to put un-namespaced attribute on namespaced element.

test-case.name: namespace-3304
test-case.description: Create prefixed attribute with namespace requested via attribute.

test-case.name: namespace-3305
test-case.description: Put namespace attribute on xsl:attribute, but set it to null (which it would have been anyway).

test-case.name: namespace-3306
test-case.description: See what happens to attribute when default namespace is declared.

test-case.name: namespace-3307
test-case.description: Have default namespace declared, request attribute in null namespace.

test-case.name: namespace-3308
test-case.description: Have default namespace declared, request attribute in namespace different from default. No prefix on attribute name. Processor must create a prefix.

test-case.name: namespace-3309
test-case.description: Have default namespace declared, request attribute in namespace same as default. No prefix on attribute name. Processor must create a prefix.

test-case.name: namespace-3310
test-case.description: Have default namespace declared, request attribute in namespace same as default. New prefix on attribute name. Processor must create a prefix.

test-case.name: namespace-3311
test-case.description: Have default namespace declared, request attribute in namespace different from default. New prefix on attribute name. Processor must create a prefix.

test-case.name: namespace-3312
test-case.description: Declare prefixed namespace at stylesheet level, then use prefix in attribute name only. No namespace nor xmlns on xsl:attribute itself.

test-case.name: namespace-3313
test-case.description: Declare prefixed namespace at stylesheet level, then use another prefix in attribute name, but same namespace. New namespace-decl must be issued, or change prefix. This test raises another facet of the issue of supplied prefixes on the attribute name. Processor developers could disagree about whether the combination of a prefixed name and an explicit namespace attribute with a URI signals a request from the stylesheet to generate a namespace declaration, even when the requested URI is already available to apply to the attribute simply by using a different prefix. In other words, does the stylesheet really want to ensure that an xmlns:other declaration is issued?

test-case.name: namespace-3314
test-case.description: FileName: namespace17 Document: http://www.w3.org/TR/xslt DocVersion: 19991116 Section: 2.4

test-case.name: namespace-3315
test-case.description: Test exclude-result-prefixes, attribute level

test-case.name: namespace-3401
test-case.description: Adding an attribute to an element replaces any existing attribute of that element with the same expanded-name. For attribute L, there is only a local name. Attribute Q has a namespace.

test-case.name: namespace-3501
test-case.description: Stylesheets are free to use any prefix, provided there is a namespace declaration that binds the prefix to the URI of the XSLT namespace.

test-case.name: namespace-3502
test-case.description: Stylesheets are free to use any prefix, provided there is a namespace declaration that binds the prefix to the URI of XSLT namespace.

result.assert-xml: <out>Testing 1 2 3 Orginal xmlns:ped quos Included xmlns:jad quos Imported xmlns:xsl quos</out>

test-case.name: namespace-3503
test-case.description: Have more than one prefix bound to the URI of XSLT namespace.

test-case.name: namespace-3504
test-case.description: Stylesheet elements may contain any element not from the XSLT namespace, provided that the expanded name of the element has a non-null namespace URI.

test-case.name: namespace-3505
test-case.description: XSLT processor must ignore a top-level element without giving and error if it does not recognize the namespace URI. The prefix used must still resolve to a URI; but that URI may not be known.

test-case.name: namespace-3601
test-case.description: Testing an attribute not from the XSLT namespace, which is legal provided that the expanded name of the attribute has a non-null namespace URI.

test-case.name: namespace-3701
test-case.description: Test of 'local-name()' function on an element.

test-case.name: namespace-3702
test-case.description: Test of 'local-name()' function on attribute in non-default namespace.

test-case.name: namespace-3703
test-case.description: Test of 'local-name()' with zero arguments.

test-case.name: namespace-3801
test-case.description: Test name functions on non-namespaced attribute node.

test-case.name: namespace-3901
test-case.description: Test of 'namespace-uri' function.

test-case.name: namespace-3902
test-case.description: Test of 'namespace-uri()' function on an element.

test-case.name: namespace-3903
test-case.description: Test of 'namespace-uri()' with no arguments.

test-case.name: namespace-4001
test-case.description: Use "plain" xsl:element while both default and prefixed NS defined at top.

test-case.name: namespace-4002
test-case.description: Use xsl:element with namespace attribute; prefix known at stylesheet level; default set.

test-case.name: namespace-4003
test-case.description: Use xsl:element with namespace attribute that matches default; another in scope.

test-case.name: namespace-4004
test-case.description: Use namespace attribute, but namespace new at that point; default was set. Requested name has no prefix, and we can get by without it.

test-case.name: namespace-4005
test-case.description: Use xsl:element with namespace attribute and default changed; prefix known at stylesheet level.

test-case.name: namespace-4006
test-case.description: Baseline test of xsl:element; stylesheet has namespace node.

test-case.name: namespace-4007
test-case.description: Use xsl:element with namespace attribute; prefix known at stylesheet level. Requested name with no prefix, so we probably get that.

test-case.name: namespace-4008
test-case.description: Use xsl:element with namespace attribute, but namespace new at that point. Requested name has no prefix, and we can get by without it.

test-case.name: namespace-4009
test-case.description: Use xsl:element with namespace attribute and default reset; prefix known at stylesheet level.

test-case.name: namespace-4101
test-case.description: Test of 'namespace-uri()' function, with hyphenated node name.

test-case.name: namespace-4301
test-case.description: Test for resetting of a namespace prefix by copy-of. Note: results affected by erratum XT.E37: see member bugzilla 931.

test-case.name: namespace-4302
test-case.description: Test copying of a namespace node by copy-of. Note: results affected by erratum XT.E37: see member bugzilla 931.

test-case.name: namespace-4401
test-case.description: Check for AVT on element name when xsl:element has namespace attribute. Name is literal, no prefix, no namespace

test-case.name: namespace-4501
test-case.description: Test for resetting of an unspecified default namespace by copy-of. extended variant of namespace137 to check special cases create an RTF with a mix of namespaced and non-namespaced elements

test-case.name: namespace-4601
test-case.description: Test name functions on default-namespace declaration. Should be null strings.

test-case.name: namespace-4801
test-case.description: Test exclude-result-prefixes.

test-case.name: namespace-4901
test-case.description: Match namespace between stylesheet, in a select, and input. Prefixes differ but the URIs are the same.

test-case.name: namespace-5001
test-case.description: Section: 7.1 Creating Elements (Namespace Node Inheritance) Show how namespaces are inherited down to succeeding elements.

test-case.name: namespace-5101
test-case.description: Simple case of creating LRE with nested namespace declarations.

test-case.name: namespace-5201
test-case.description: Purpose: Test of local-name and name() on namespace axis. The local-name() function should work on this axis, returning the same value as name(). The XML parser has freedom to present namespaces in any order it wants. The input should have only one namespace if you want consistent results across parsers.

test-case.name: namespace-5301
test-case.description: Test name functions on processing instructions.

test-case.name: namespace-5401
test-case.description: Test name functions on comments.

test-case.name: namespace-5501
test-case.description: Test name functions on text nodes.

test-case.name: namespace-5601
test-case.description: Test of local-name() on default namespace declaration.

test-case.name: namespace-5602
test-case.description: Test of namespace-uri() on default namespace declaration. Part 4 of the Namespaces in XML spec says "The prefix xmlns is used only for namespace bindings and is not itself bound to any namespace name.

test-case.name: namespace-5701
test-case.description: Test of namespace-uri() on namespaces.

result.assert-xml:
<out>Namespaces for docs:|;
  Namespaces for doc:|;|;
    Namespaces for section:|;|;|;
      Namespaces for inner:|;|;|;|;
    
  
</out>

test-case.name: namespace-5901
test-case.description: Create attribute with QName and namespace which restates same URI.

test-case.name: namespace-5902
test-case.description: Create attribute with QName whose prefix is known.

test-case.name: namespace-5903
test-case.description: Create attribute with NCName and newly-introduced namespace. Processor will have to invent a prefix because none has been established for that namespace.

test-case.name: namespace-6001
test-case.description: Use xsl:element with namespace in AVT, comes out as null string.

test-case.name: namespace-6002
test-case.description: Use xsl:element with namespace that is AVT, URI matches one already in scope. Requested name has no NS prefix, so we probably get just that.

test-case.name: namespace-6003
test-case.description: Use xsl:element with a namespace that has AVT, introduces new namespace.

test-case.name: namespace-6101
test-case.description: When there two prefixes for an NS URI, exclude-result-prefixes of one prefix excludes all for that URI.
